docs.lead_paragraph: We have a real treat for you this morning: the latest in our "Long Run" series about the presidential candidates is a Michael Powell composition about then-Mayor Rudolph W. Giuliani and his relationship with Bernard B. Kerik. The former police commissioner currently faces several felony charges, and Mr. Giuliani has faced questions about what he knew about Mr. Kerik and when he knew it. Here's the crux of the issue:

headline.main: The Early Word: The Kerik Relationship, Clinton Papers

docs.abstract: His relationship with Bernard Kerik prompts lingering questions about Rudy Giuliani's judgment, while most voters will have a chance to judge Hillary Clinton through her White House papers before they go to the polls.

byline.original: By STEPHANIE SAUL and ALEX BERENSON

docs.lead_paragraph: CIGNA PROFIT UP 22% The health insurer Cigna said yesterday that third-quarter earnings rose 22 percent on increased premiums and fees, but shares fell when the company's 2008 forecast disappointed Wall Street. Cigna, which also sells disability and life insurance, said net income climbed to $365 million, or $1.28 a share, from $298 million, or 92 cents a share, a year earlier. Total revenue rose to $4.41 billion, from $4.14 billion in the 2006 quarter. Looking ahead to 2008, however, Cigna expects to post adjusted income from operations of $1.16 billion to $1.21 billion, or $4 to $4.20 a share, missing Wall Street average expectations of $4.23 a share. (AP)
docs.abstract: Cigna reports that third-quarter earnings rose 22 percent on increased premiums and fees, but shares fall on disappointing 2008 forecast; says net income was $365 million, from $298 million year earlier; total revenue rose to $4.41 billion, from $4.14 billion (S)
